trans-unit.source: After you perform a backup, or if you experience hardware or operating system failure, you can use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> system function to verify that the database is still consistent.

seg-source.mrk: After you perform a backup, or if you experience hardware or operating system failure, you can use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> system function to verify that the database is still consistent.

target.mrk: After you perform a backup, or if you experience hardware or operating system failure, you can use the <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> system function to verify that the database is still consistent.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on all the tables in a database offline after you back it up. Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one. Otherwise, check consistency only if there are indications that such a check is needed, because a consistency check can take a long time on a large database.

seg-source.mrk: It is recommended that you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on all the tables in a database offline after you back it up.
Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one.
Otherwise, check consistency only if there are indications that such a check is needed, because a consistency check can take a long time on a large database.

target.mrk: It is recommended that you run <codeph>SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_CHECK_TABLE</codeph> on all the tables in a database offline after you back it up.
Do not discard the previous backup until you have verified the consistency of the current one.
Otherwise, check consistency only if there are indications that such a check is needed, because a consistency check can take a long time on a large database.
